titles.title: To authorize the extension of nondiscriminatory treatment (most-favored-nation treatment) to the products of Romania.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 104-629.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 315.

action.text: Mr. Crane moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 334 - 86 (Roll no. 325).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 3/26/1996--Introduced. Authorizes the President to: (1) determine that title IV of the Trade Act of 1974, including certain emigration requirements, shall no longer apply to Romania; and (2) extend nondiscriminatory treatment (most-favored-nation status) to the products of Romania.
